TEXTILES.budget: Positive - Integrated Programme with National Fibre Scheme and 5 Mega Textile Parks. Export period extended for garment exporters.
TEXTILES.rbi: Neutral - No specific mention, but stable rates aid working capital intensive units.
TEXTILES.eco_survey: Pivoting towards Man-Made Fibres (MMF) and technical textiles. PM-MITRA parks to facilitate economies of scale.

AGRICULTURE.budget: Very Positive - Launch of 'Bharat-VISTAAR' AI tool and programmes for Coconut/Cashew/Cocoa. Tax relief for cooperatives.
AGRICULTURE.rbi: Neutral - Monitoring inflation; rural demand expected to remain steady.
AGRICULTURE.eco_survey: Shifting from food security to nutritional security. Focus on diversifying towards pulses, oilseeds, and maize.

RAILWAYS.budget: Strong Growth - 7 new High-Speed Rail corridors (Mumbai-Pune, Delhi-Varanasi) and new Freight Corridors (Dankuni-Surat).
RAILWAYS.rbi: Neutral - Indirect benefit from infrastructure thrust.
RAILWAYS.eco_survey: Transformation via record capex. Key priorities: Dedicated Freight Corridors and Economic Railway Corridors.

DEFENCE.budget: Positive - Customs duty exemption on aircraft parts. Expenditure allocation set at ₹5.94 lakh crore.
DEFENCE.eco_survey: Focus on strategic indigenisation (Tier I priorities). Growing capabilities in engines, drones, and AUVs.

CHEMICALS.budget: Positive - Scheme for 3 dedicated Chemical Parks. Promotion of CCUS technologies.
CHEMICALS.eco_survey: Strong linkages with refining; industrial chemicals categorized as high-urgency for indigenisation.

AUTO.budget: Positive - Duty exemption on Li-Ion cell capital goods. Rising EV registrations noted as key trend.
AUTO.rbi: Positive - Strong momentum in two-wheeler and tractor sales (double digit growth).
AUTO.eco_survey: Rapid transition to electric mobility via PLI and PM E-DRIVE. Positioning as global hub for small cars.

BANKING.budget: Reformist - High Level Committee for Viksit Bharat setup. Restructuring of PFC/REC to improve efficiency.
BANKING.rbi: Neutral - Repo rate held at 5.25%. Banks permitted to lend to REITs. New guidelines to curb mis-selling.
BANKING.eco_survey: Healthy system with GNPA at multi-decade low (2.2%). Diversification of funding sources emphasized.

INFRASTRUCTURE.budget: Bullish - Capex raised to ₹12.2 lakh crore. New Risk Guarantee Fund and CIE manufacturing scheme.
INFRASTRUCTURE.rbi: Positive - Construction growth expected to remain firm.
INFRASTRUCTURE.eco_survey: Shift to logistics efficiency via PM GatiShakti. Focus on crowding-in private investment via InvITs/REITs.

IT.budget: Positive - Safe harbour margin fixed at 15.5%. India Semiconductor Mission 2.0 launched.
IT.rbi: Neutral - Framework for limiting customer liability in digital transactions announced.
IT.eco_survey: Evolving from support to core value creator. Expansion of Global Capability Centres (GCCs) into AI/Deep-tech.

PHARMA.budget: Positive - 'Biopharma SHAKTI' launched with ₹10k cr outlay. Customs duty exemption on 17 cancer drugs.
PHARMA.eco_survey: Reducing import dependence on APIs/KSMs via PLI. Transitioning from generics to innovation-led discovery.

FMCG.budget: Mixed - Duty rationalization on tobacco (Negative). Programmes for Cashew/Cocoa brands (Positive).
FMCG.rbi: Positive - Benign inflation expected to support consumption.
FMCG.eco_survey: Broad-based recovery with rural demand strengthening. Rising consumption of processed foods noted.

POWER.budget: Positive - Duty exemption for Nuclear projects extended to 2035. ₹20k cr for Carbon Capture (CCUS).
POWER.rbi: Neutral - Restructuring of power financing NBFCs noted.
POWER.eco_survey: Massive transition to non-fossil fuel. SHANTI Act signals push for Small Modular Reactors.

REALTY.budget: Indirect Positive - Infrastructure push supports peripheral development.
REALTY.rbi: Positive - Banks permitted to lend to REITs, freeing up funds for developers.
REALTY.eco_survey: Asset monetization via REITs emphasized to crowd-in private investment.

NBFC.budget: Neutral - Focus on public sector NBFCs (PFC/REC).
NBFC.rbi: Positive - Regulatory ease for 'Type I NBFCs'. Collateral-free loan limit for MSEs doubled to ₹20 lakh.
NBFC.eco_survey: Large corporations increasingly relying on non-bank instruments.
